instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> loses image at login
threads.message:
I have an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that came to me after a screen replacement.
Works fine in safe mode but in regular mode it loses image at the login prompt, just a few seconds after showing prompt.
Image will return sometimes after pressing a few keys, then go right back out.
Backlight is on entire time, I have tried resetting pram and disconnecting battery and draining capacitors, no change.
Diagnostic mode shows no errors.
Any ideas? I'm wondering if perhaps the people that changed the screen used an incorrect part number.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> loses image at login
